title: I am Badministrator AMA
body:
I want to be able to claim that I did the first AMA on here even if it's a miserable failure because there are no users yet.

I make League music.  Here's my youtube: http://www.youtube.com/user/visix

I'm also plat 2 solo queue and I've been playing for a long time.  Ask me questions or insult me or whatever. <3

Edit: I just realized the community team is already doing an AMA so this is an even bigger failure than before.  Cool.

replies.body: What inspired you to create your first League song?

My inspiration was a love of Urgot and a long commute home from work.  No one shows Urgot any love so I thought I'd do a song.  I had never rapped before but it seemed like the easiest format to knock out a quick parody for my main crab.  People liked it so I kept going.
Do you love me?
I think this relationship is moving too fast.
send pics
Are you playing your love games with me?

It seems like collaborations are a big part of the LoL-inspired music scene. You've even mentioned a couple hot collabos in the works, which I'm looking forward to. Do you have a personal relationship with other artists in the space? That is, do you ever hang out, play, chat or whatever with them when you're not working on a piece together?

Thanks for doing this, love your work!

I don't know anyone IRL, they are all way too far away and my job makes it so I can't go to events (I am a programmer/analyst for some nuclear power stations).  I do play with pretty much everyone I've collabed with on occasion but like most anyone else who is late teens low 20s they generally all have a group of friends big enough they don't need more people.  I am 31 and my friends are all busy with offspring and adultish stuff instead of gaming. So yes, the answer is yes.

Yes!  This is prime info I'm about to give out.  I am currently working on a rap song that is like a love note from Garen to Katerina.  I am also doing a jungling song with Cody and Collective from PlayerPOV.  My part is going to be Zac, I don't know exactly what they are doing yet.

I have already remastered The Gentleman so it sounds a million times better.  You can get the new MP3 from my download site.  I remade the video with the new audio but I hesitate to post it so you can listen and tell me if I should.  Download site: http://badmin.trinityforcepodcast.com

Thanks for the kind words!

Why have you not done a 'demacia, f*#k yeah' parody to the tune of 'america, f*#k yeah?' (from Team America: World Police)

just curious, it seems like an obvious fit.. my $0.02.
Oh and I very much like your stuff... have listened to a lot.

Thanks buddy.  First and foremost I never had that idea.  Second, I don't make videos and that idea is just begging for a hilarious video.  Third, people complain when I swear in my songs... I know it's weird.  Fourth, I don't really do parodies much.

All that said you got me seriously considering this.
I remember you writing somewhere that you don't listen to a lot of hip-hop. Is this true? How did you craft your style of lyricism/rapping?

Hi Phreak!

That is true.  I basically didn't listen to any at all before I made my first song except what I might have heard occasionally on the radio. As for my style of rapping I think it is just what comes naturally to me as a person who enjoys music.  I play the guitar and the drums so rhythm is not an issue.  My first few songs were parody style and I basically ripped off the feel of the original song.  While not exactly the same like the word replace parodies you see from someone like Instalok or Plentakill the flows I was using weren't exactly original either.  Over time my style grew naturally out of the songs I was creating and at a certain point I began to feel confined by the feel of parodies more than helped by the established flow within them.  So I basically stopped doing parodies and my natural rhythm took over from there.

Lately I've been more focused on having good rhymes in addition to having good lyrics which aren't necessarily the same thing.  While league fans and fans of lyrics were enjoying my songs I wouldn't say that fans of rap in general wouldn't have found them too enjoyable up until my last 10 or so because of a lack of multis and more complex rhymes.

All in all it's just a natural progression as I gain experience.  As people expect more from me I put in more effort and my past experiences allow me to sound more polished.  Where I might have spent two hours writing a whole song before I now sometimes spend two hours writing four lines.  This is basically the reason I don't get songs out as often as I used to.  I am trying to avoid the comment "this song is not as good as your other songs", it's the worst thing to see as a content creator.

Do you really get up at 5am during playoffs?  Damn.
Is there one song that you would completely revisit and take another approach on it and why?

If we're talking rap then it's my Udyr song.  I just hate it.  There are basically only two lines in the whole song that don't make me cringe.  I can't even listen to it.

My Olaf rock song is just poorly made.  I had no idea how to mix rock music at the time so it came out really awful.  I would redo it except no one really liked the idea or the song I was parodying in the first place.
Totally love your work, keep it my friend :)
Thanks!  I will continue to try to find time to post content to my youtube.  I am hoping to get my production up this winter and I feel really bad not having posted a song since July.
With reworked Yi as he is, do you still run Soraka-Yi duo? :P

That was actually Kolo9 and Chickencombo from Plentakill's duo.  The whole song was about their dominion experiences I just wrote the lyrics and rapped it.  The song is totally fabricated though, they are not very good at LoL but they have a good time playing.
LMAO at this song, does Riot know you make these funny rap songs?
I think so!  There are six Riot people commenting in this thread and Phreak uses my music when he streams =)
Badminstrator, why you so awesome :D?
I'm not.

Hey Badministrator! I first heard of you when Welcome to the League of Draven came out, needless to say your raps are awesome!  I really liked Dear Summoner, your Annie song.  Annie's monologue to her summoner is just hilarious; have you thought of doing any more songs about a champion either praising or cursing his summoner?

If the idea calls for it I think it could be done.  In general I like to keep it positive.  The only reason I did that song with a negative spin is because it's a champion raging instead of a person/player.  Generally I would prefer to pretend the game environment is an autonomous world instead of just a game people are playing because I feel like the songs turn out more interesting and immersive that way.

I want to say I love your music, it's fun and I'm always excited when I see you've posted something new.

You mentioned you had a love for Urgot, but what are a few of your favorite characters - and why?

P.S. A Harrowing song would be awesome.
Lux and Leona are my two favorites but most recently I've been playing Zyra and Brand the most.  I just like the ranged burstiness and I mostly prefer champs with skillshots.
Ever considered give Xerath a try? He has tons of range and 2 skill shots. Also has the highest base burst in the game. Might be fun to give him a try before the remake.

Hey Visix! If I wanted to record and do music what programs would you recommend and how would one go about rapping. I have tried but I feel awkward about it, maybe on account of being white idk but any advice would be much appreciated!

You can use audacity for a free program, just download a karaoke instrumental of a rap song and go to it.  I'm white, doesn't mean anything.  You feel awkward because you're bad at rapping because you've never done it before.  Like anything else rapping takes practice. Contrary to what many people think it is not just talking over a beat.
Unless you're Snoop Do-... Lion.
If you think you can sound as good as Snoop by just talking over a beat go ahead and get famous.  It's harder than it seems.  Snoop's rhythm is on point and his delivery is unique and calculated.

didn't read this comment when it was first posted but I'll just go out of my way to say that I've actually listened to a lot more Snoop since then, and I have a lot more respect for his flow than I used to. he's damned good.
Have you ever considered doing a song for Xerath?
Will you do more work with other LoL musicians (Plentakill and the like)?

I currently have plans to do a song with PlayerPOV.  Plentakill hasn't asked me lately so I can't comment on them.  I want to get something going with Lily Pichu or Natsumii but it's just hard for me to write parts for them.

Im a huge anivia fan, and i absolutely love your lyrics in her song but im wondering if its possible to do another one maybe with a different beat style or anything? Also bang bang was on a whole new level. i loved it. Keep up the awesome work.

I can't really justify playing an entire new song for a champion when there are so many I've done nothing for.  The only way I can see her getting mentioned in another song anytime soon is if I do the other Freljord factions.
Love your stuff dude, went nuts for your Naut and Heimer raps
Thanks man.  Those are a couple of my favorites that I feel are generally underrated.

Badmin. ur music is great. love all of em. specially time to die, walk the plank, breathe redux, and big paws. Going to be downloading your three recent ones soon since i just got my laptop back and running. I wanted to make a request of a new song if u have the time, on either another Anivia tribute or Lissandra using "Super Cold" from Lupe fiasco's Friend of the People mix. just a suggestion but thanks for your 10 secs of thinking about it. :)

I am trying really hard to get away from using instrumentals from commercial rap songs because of the associated issues with copyright infringement and other legal considerations.  Unfortunately at this time it's really unlikely I'll be able to do something with that beat.  Really nice beat though, it's pretty simple too so a remake isn't out of the question.
no big. dont want anyone sueing you. how do you feel about different characters and their roles and capabilities?

It won't let me reply below so I'll do it here.  Mechanically I play a high plat mid and support, a gold top, a silver jungle, and a bronze ADC.  I don't mind playing any role but I feel bad not pulling my weight so I try to make it clear in champ select what I'm good at so no one is surprised when I have poor right click micro in teamfights as ADC.  I like to win but it's no big deal if I lose so if I'm last pick and forced into a role I'm not great at I just deal with it.
ok. how do u feel about zed being in mid? cause it caught me of guard when he started showing up there.
That's kind of a big question.  Can you be more specific?
sorry. i mean what is you preference and is their any roles you utterly cant play or are you that guy in rank that doesn't mind what role hes given?

Hey Badmin. I've always been a big fan of your work I love the winter's claw song (I'm a die hard sehuani fan) and really enjoyed the route you took with corporate mundo even though I've never been a fan of the champion.

I love giving back when I enjoy peoples work if you ever want exclusive art for your videos or splashes I'd love to collaborate with you on some. You can check out my art and contact me here.
http://www.youtube.com/lessthanpi
